title: Red Receives the Basket and Warning
summary: Red’s mother packs a basket of medicine and food for her sick grandmother and warns Red to stay on the main path and avoid strangers. Red protests, wanting to take a shortcut through the woods, but her mother insists, highlighting rumors of a dangerous presence in the forest. Red reluctantly agrees and sets out, motivated by concern for her grandmother and impatience with her mother’s rules.

title: Entering the Woods and Meeting the Huntsman
summary: Red encounters the local huntsman on the forest path, who questions her about her destination and warns her that something has been killing livestock at night. Red assures him she’ll be careful, but after he leaves, she chooses the forbidden shortcut to save time, deciding her grandmother’s need outweighs her mother’s warning.

title: Red’s Shortcut and the Wolf’s Stalking
summary: As Red takes the shortcut, she drops her basket and, while retrieving it, notices signs of a predator—claw marks and broken branches. The wolf observes her from the shadows, deciding Red will lead him to an easier meal: her sick grandmother. Red senses she’s being watched and quickens her pace, torn between returning or pressing on.

title: Wolf Tricks Red with a Riddle
summary: The wolf reveals himself, disguised as a kindly traveler, and engages Red in conversation, asking about her destination and offering riddles. Red, suspicious but not alarmed, tries to end the conversation, but the wolf suggests an alternate route promising wildflowers for her grandmother. Red decides to trust him, thinking the gesture kind, and changes her path.

title: Wolf Arrives at Grandmother’s House First
summary: The wolf sprints ahead, using the shortcut he gave Red, and breaks into Grandmother’s house. He threatens her, demanding she hide in the cellar and takes her shawl to disguise himself. The wolf’s motivation is to set a trap for Red, knowing she will arrive soon and suspect nothing.

title: Red Arrives and Senses Something Wrong
summary: Red enters the house and notices strange details: muddy footprints, scattered furniture, and the grandmother’s door locked. She calls out, but the wolf, impersonating Grandmother, beckons her in with a hoarse voice. Red hesitates, debating whether to enter, but the urgency of delivering the medicine compels her to approach.

title: Red Confronts the Wolf and Fights Back
summary: Red enters the bedroom and immediately realizes something is wrong—her ‘grandmother’ looks monstrous. The wolf attacks, revealing his true identity. Red grabs a fireplace poker and fights back, injuring the wolf enough to escape into the hallway, yelling for help.

title: The Huntsman’s Rescue and Final Showdown
summary: The huntsman, hearing Red’s screams while passing nearby, bursts into the house. He confronts the wolf, who turns on him, leading to a violent struggle. Red retrieves the key and frees her grandmother from the cellar, and together they distract the wolf long enough for the huntsman to deliver a fatal blow.

title: Aftermath and Red’s New Resolve
summary: With the wolf dead, the huntsman checks the house for other threats while Red and her grandmother recover. Red admits her mistake in trusting the stranger and ignoring her mother’s warnings. She decides to always prioritize caution and vows to protect her family, learning the consequences of her decisions through concrete experience.
